bibl.seg: José das Candeias Sales, Petosiris. Um activo construtor da memória egípcia do início do período ptolomaico.
El narrador como hombre de acción: la construcción de la memoria colectiva en el mundo grecorromano = Studia historica. Historia antigua 29 (2011) pp. 17-38, 1 arbre généal., 1 tabl.

The long text of philosophical and religious inspiration attributed to Petosiris, a high priest of the god Djehuti / Tot in the Egyptian region of Hermopolis in the IV-III centuries B.C., carved on the interior walls of his tomb at Tuna el-Gebel, is a compact repository of individual, familiar and civilizational memory as well as both ethical and moral principles which fits in the multimillenary Egyptian wisdom tradition. - Avec résumés en portugais, en espagnol et en anglais.
